channel.title: Posts on Pascal's dev blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Pascal's dev blog

item.title: The best JS Framework
item.description: Every now and then, a new JS framework arises. Every two days it seems. Some of them gain much more traction than others, like React, Angular or Vue. Most of them have a much more limited popularity. The authors of each of them claim it’s greater than others. They create benchmarks to prove their framework is the fastest. They compare some of them from multiple points of views: technical, feature list, syntax, performance, weight… to support this assertion.

item.title: Elm Europe 2017 - Day 2
item.description:
Ce billet est le second d’une série de deux consacrée à la conférence Elm Europe 2017.

This blog post is the second of a series of two about the Elm Europe 2017 conference.

item.title: Elm Europe 2017 day 1

Ce billet est le premier d’une série de deux consacrée à la conférence Elm Europe 2017.

item.title: Creating a mobile application with React Native - part 5
item.description: In this fifth part of the article series about React Native, we’ll see how to support the native back button on Android devices.

item.title: Creating a mobile application with React Native - part 4
item.description: This fourth part in the React Native article series will be dedicated to adding an artist search feature.

item.title: Creating a mobile application with React Native - part 3
item.description: In this third part of the series we will see of to navigate through different screens in the application.

item.title: Creating a mobile application with React Native - part 2
item.description:
This article is the second in a series started with Creating a mobile application with React Native - part 1.

Today, we will enrich our basic app with a list of albums provided by the deezer API. We will use Native Base, which is a complement to React Native. It provides higher level, polished components and layouts, for both iOS and Android.

item.title: Creating a mobile application with React Native - part 1
item.description: These is the first post of a series dedicated to the creation of a mobile application for both Android and iOS.

item.title: Hello World!
item.description:
Hi!

On this new blog I will talk about software development. I will share things I learned, sometimes the hard way^^, and maybe some thoughts about technology and/or methodology.
